creator: aspa@kronodoc.fi
text:
the UNIX JMeter startup scripts in bin directory don't have their execute
permissions on when extracted from the tar.gz package.

when i try running JMeter (RedHat 7.3 Linux) using bin/jmeter script i get the
following error message:

[aspa@localhost bin]$ ./jmeter 
bash: ./jmeter: bad interpreter: Permission denied

when i convert the file from dos to UNIX format (dos2unix) the script runs fine.

creator: alibby@commnav.com
text:
This is because the interpreter (/bin/sh) is actually
/bin/sh^M. Quick fix is to remove the interpreter line
and re-add (in UN*X).  Perhaps ant's FixCRLF task can be
leveraged at build or deployment time.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 9373 ***
creator: mstover1@apache.org
jsalvata@atg.com
text:
Marking all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8's release date as VERIFIED.
Yes, it's pretty poor QA procedure, but there's bugs here lingering since JMeter
1.6, and we need to clean up a little.

creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text: Bulk-closing all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8 release date.
